patterns: Tell me about asymmetric information in finance markets
Do you know about asymmetric information?
What do you mean by asymmetric information?
responses: It is a type of market failure that exists when one individual or party has much more information than another individual or party, and uses that advantage to exploit the other party.
In finance, it refers to situations where a potential borrower (such as a small business) has better information on the likelihood that they will be able to repay a loan than the lender.

patterns: Do you know about bail-out in financial markets?
What do critics and supporters say about bail-out?
responses: A bail-out happens when a government buys an equity stake in a bank or provides some other form of financial support to prevent it from failing

Critics argue that it can increase the burden on taxpayers and also increase the risk of moral hazard. Supporters claim that bail-outs are sometimes necessary during a financial crisis to help reduce systemic risk.
Bail-outs have become prominent once again because of the economic and social consequences of the coronavirus crisis.

What do you mean by a balance sheet?
responses: A balance sheet is a statement of the assets, liabilities, and capital of a business or other organization at a particular point in time, detailing the balance of income and expenditure over the preceding period.
It is one of the three fundamental financial statements, and is key to both financial modeling and accounting.
